author: MSNBC.com
title: Europe’s neo-Nazis: Are they taking cues from America’s Commander-in-Chief?
description: NBC’s chief foreign correspondent Richard Engel travels to Germany for a neo-Nazi rock festival where he meets devoted white nationalists inspired by the country’s dark history.
source.name: MSNBC

title: How the Far Right uses social media to take their message mainstream
description: Meet the Identitarians. This far-right youth movement promotes its message via slick social media stunts.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Massacre at Walmart: Did the President’s words inspire a real-world tragedy?
description: Following a mass shooting at a Walmart in El Paso, Texas, the community tries to understand what drove the gunman to carry out such an atrocity.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Despite increased measures to prevent spread, COVID-19 cases soar in Europe.
description: Italy, the worst-hit European country, reported 651 new deaths  from coronavirus on Sunday, bringing the total there to 5,476.  NBC News' Ali Arouzi reports from London on the crisis sweeping Europe.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Physicians explain what's needed to curb virus
description: Drs. Aaron Campbell, Ashish Jha and Dave Campbell join Morning Joe to discuss the measures needed in the U.S. to combat the coronavirus.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Doctor criticizes Sen. Paul for not self-quarantining
description: Sen. Rand Paul, R-Ky., became the first known Senator to test positive for the coronavirus, which has sent shock waves through Congress. Sen. Ezekiel Emanuel criticizes Sen. Paul, who is a physician, for not going into self-quarantine.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Historian explains how wartime powers can help
description: The president keeps saying he's a wartime president yet he resists using wartime powers. Historian Jon Meacham discusses.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Joe calls for a government site to list mask, glove production
description: Joe Scarborough calls for a government web site that will list the production of masks, gloves, protective gear, testing and ventilators.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Coronavirus stimulus bill fails in Senate, Sen. Paul tests positive
description: A vote to advance a massive coronavirus stimulus bill failed Sunday night in the Senate as negotiations so far had yet to produce a deal on the more than $1 trillion aid package. Mika Brzezinski has the latest updates.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Breaking down Trump's Sunday news conference
description: Joe Scarborough and Mika Brzezinski both weigh in on the president's Sunday news conference with members of the White House Coronavirus Task Force.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: The AMA calls on Trump to use 'all levers' to get medical supplies
description: American Medical Association President, Dr. Patrice Harris, joins Morning Joe to discuss critical supply shortages at U.S. hospitals and why the AMA is calling on the president to use all levers to get those supplies.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Congresswoman calls for rousing manufacturing base
description: Rep. Haley Stevens, D-Mich., says she's ready to work with the president to get factories in her state producing the protective equipment U.S. health care workers need to fight against the coronavirus.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Florida governor calls for stay-at-home order
description: Rep. Debbie Mucarsel-Powell, D-Fla., discusses why she's calling for a stay-at-home order for her state and why she's concerned Gov. Ron DeSantis isn't doing enough to stop the spread of the virus.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'Shut down this country for two weeks'
description: Joe Scarborough calls on President Trump to follow the advice of public health experts and shut down the country for two weeks in order to get a better handle on the spread of the coronavirus.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Defense secretary says 133 military COVID-19 cases 'won't affect readiness'
description: During a press conference at the Pentagon, Defense Secretary Mark Esper notes 133 military personnel have contracted COVID-19, and says it will not affect readiness in the United States and war zones.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: NYT: Scientists identify 69 drugs to test against virus
description: A new report found nearly 70 existing drugs could be effective in treating the coronavirus. Stephanie Ruhle is joined by infectious disease expert Dr. William Haseltine about what that means in the search for a COVID-19 cure.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Elizabeth Warren on the standoff over stimulus bill
description: Watch Massachusetts Senator Elizabeth Warren join Stephanie Ruhle to share her stance on the Senate's standoff over the stimulus bill and what lawmakers hope to get done as the effects of coronavirus continue to spread.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Morning Joe 3/23/20
description: Joe and Mika discuss the big news of the day.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Ed Markey defends Senate Democrats blocking emergency coronavirus bill
description: Sen. Ed Markey (D-Mass.) speaks with Andrea Mitchell about why Senate Democrats blocked a coronavirus stimulus package, saying that "we need guardrails around this $500B that (Treasury Secretary) Steve Mnuchin wants but doesn't want to disclose where this mon…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Schumer takes issue with corporate bailouts in stimulus bill: ‘We need to protect the workers’
description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer outlines Democrats’ problems with the current coronavirus stimulus bill, and instead calls for a “workers first” proposal.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'Are you kidding me?': McConnell blasts Democrats over coronavirus stimulus deadlock
description: As Congresss remains deadlocked over a coronavirus stimulus bill, Senator Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., blasted his Democratic colleagues over their "wish list" of items that they would like to see in the legislation.
source.name: MSNBC

author: Msnbc
title: Three words Trump should not utter about epidemiology: 'Just a feeling'
description: There's a real threat that Trump will shape public policy while ignoring experts and going with his "hunches" and "feelings."
content:
Earlier this month, as Americans were just starting to come to terms with the coronavirus crisis, Donald Trump rejected the World Health Organization's assessment on fatality rates. As the president put it on March 4, "[T]his is just my hunch."
Just two days… [+3310 chars]
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: U.S. healthcare workers confronting spike in virus cases
description: Chief Medical Officer for SSM Health, Dr. Alexander Garza, joins Stephanie Ruhle to discuss the continuing uptick in U.S. Coronavirus cases.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Democrats and Republicans at odds over details of coronavirus stimulus package
description: On capitol hill, congress is deadlocked over the Senate Republican stimulus proposal. Democrats say the bill functions as a handout to big business - and doesn't provide enough support for the state and local governments on the front lines of this crisis. But…

title: Senator Tammy Baldwin: 'We are making progress' on the coronavirus relief stimulus
description: Senator Tammy Baldwin joins MSNBC’s Stephanie Ruhle to discuss updates on the proposed stimulus package.

title: Pelosi unveils new act as coronavirus stimulus bill fails for a second time
description: Negotiations are still underway on Capitol Hill for ‘phase three’ of the coronavirus stimulus package. After the bill failed in the Senate for a second time House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., unveiled the "Take Responsibility for Workers and Family Act" in…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Former Homeland Secretary explains how Defense Production Act...
description: Michael Chertoff, who served as Homeland Secretary under George W. Bush, joins Andrea Mitchell to explain how the Trump administration can use the emergency powers in the Defense Production Act to facilitate the response to the coronavirus and get supplies to…
source.name: MSNBC

title: Inside NYC’s first responder response: 'The great unknown' has people concerned
description: NBC's Tom Winter discusses what it's like for New York City's first responders during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: COVID-19 deaths surpass 500 in U.S.: Washington Post
description: Number of COVID-19 deaths surpass 500 nationally as the number of cases continue to rise.

title: Dr. Gupta: A national lockdown was needed ‘from the get-go’

title: Democrats hold coronavirus stimulus over transparency and local funding
description: NBC's Garrett Haake brings the latest from Capitol Hill and the details of the standoff between Democrats and Republicans over the coronavirus stimulus package.

title: Pregnancy and COVID-19: New York hospital disallows partners during childbirth
description: Dr. Leana Wen gives the public health perspective of COVID-19, adding how the pandemic is affecting everyone including pregnant women.

title: Human Rights Campaign warns LGBTQ community is at risk during coronavius crisis
description: Human Rights Campaign president Alphonso David joins Alicia Menendez to discuss the unique challenges the LGBTQ community faces amid the coronavirus crisis.

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump may be losing patience with economic effects of virus shutdown
description: Axios National Political Reporter Jonathan Swan discusses how "Trump is losing patience with the public health prescriptions."

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Gillibrand: 'President isn't making any sense' on wanting to return to normalcy
description: On President Trump wanting to begin ‘opening up our country,’ despite the continuing coronavirus outbreak, Senator Gillibrand says “the president isn’t making any sense. In fact, we have a major health crisis in front of us.”

title: Trump wants to begin 'opening up our country' despite coronavirus outbreak

title: Trump disavows ‘nasty language’ toward Asian Americans amid pandemic
description: After receiving criticism for referring to COVID-19 as the “Wuhan virus” or “Chinese virus,” President Trump committed to protecting the Asian American community in the U.S. from racist attacks, driven by misinformation about the virus.

title: Trump jokingly walks away as doctor says she had fever over weekend

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump fact-checked by top doctor: Virus cases rising for weeks to come
description: As the coronavirus continues to spread, Pres. Trump is suggesting it will soon be time to reassess measures that limit its spread. A leading medical expert says that view rests on a false premise, because today's confirmed cases are actually “two weeks behind…
